newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain to present law in 1998 to cut taxes - Rato.
newsitem.headline: Spain to present law in 1998 to cut taxes - Rato.

text.p: Spain's Economy Minister Rodrigo Rato said on Thursday the government would present a new law in 1998 to cut income taxes.
Rato said earlier in the week the overall tax burden would fall from 1999 as long as the public deficit is at two percent of gross domestic product (GDP).
"In 1998 we will present a new law to parliament to reduce income taxes," Rato told state radio.
As part of its election platform in 1996, the Popular Party promised income tax cuts.
"These new taxes will be introduced in 1999 (after approval 1998)," Rato said.
The new income tax law will include a revision of tax- deductable items.
"We will also study deductions because a few of them do not make sense while others could be more generous for the new Spanish society," he said.
